qas.question: How many locks are contained in Suez Canal?
What direction does the canal north of Bitter lakes flow?

answers.text: north in winter and south in summer

context: The canal is <a0_0>193.30 km (120.11 mi)<a0_0/> long, <a1_0>24 m (79 ft)<a1_0/> deep and <a2_0>205 metres (673 ft)<a2_0/> wide as of 2010. It consists of the northern access channel of 22 km (14 mi), the canal itself of 162.25 km (100.82 mi) and the southern access channel of 9 km (5.6 mi). The canal is a single lane with passing places in the "Ballah By-Pass" and the Great Bitter Lake. It contains <a3_0>no locks<a3_0/>; seawater flows freely through the canal. In general, the canal north of the Bitter Lakes flows <a4_0>north in winter and south in summer<a4_0/>. The current south of the lakes changes with the tide at Suez.
